author: Ron Kohavi
title: Scaling Up the Accuracy of Naive-Bayes Classifiers: A Decision-Tree Hybrid
window: the accuracy of medical diagnosis from 98% to 99% may cut costs by half because the number of errors is halved. Figure 5 shows the ratio of errors (where error is 100%-accuracy). The shuttle dataset, which is the largest dataset tested, has only 0.04% absolute difference between NBTree and C4.5, but the error decreases from 0.05% to 0.01%, which is a huge relative improvement.
